awd_abstract_narration: Roswell Park Memorial Institute will initiate an 8-week                         combined residential and commuter Young Scholars project for                    20 students in grade l2 in molecular biology.  The Roswell                      Park Summer Research Program will be entering its 37th                          continuous year of operation in l990.  Twenty high ability                      high school students completing their junior year will be                       selected from across the country to participate.  Students                      will spend one day a week in the classroom and four days a                      week in the laboratory.  In the classroom, students will                        receive lectures in molecular and cell biology, science and                     ethics, career exploration and a special NSF Distinguished                      Lecture Series.  Program evaluation will be conducted in a                      variety of ways and assess both program and student.                            Students will be followed-up several months to one year after                   participation to gauge success and to identify problems                         and/or provide counseling.  Periodic newsletters will also be                   sent.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)

inst.inst_name: Roswell Park Cancer Institute, Division of Health Research, Inc
